intro: Webera hispidula, commonly known as the hairy webera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
